p: Baseline HIV prevalence was 22% (women: 26%, men: 12%) and baseline Herpes simplex virus type-2 (HSV-2) prevalence was 46% (women: 54%, men: 24%). The prevalence of both infections was similar across study arms (HIV: 21% Arm A, 21% Arm B, 22% Arm C; HSV-2: 46% Arm A; 46% Arm B, 45% Arm C). Reported ART coverage was slightly higher in Arm B (33% Arm A, 41% Arm B, 35% Arm C), but the proportion of HIV-positive participants with VS at PC0 was similar across study arms (56% Arm A, 57% Arm B, 54% Arm C).
